t: For the director of music. According to gittith. Of the Sons of Korah. A psalm.
How*pn lovely is your dwelling place, Lord*sld Almighty!
My*ln soul yearns, even faints, for*ld the courts of the Lord;*s my*ln heart and my flesh cry out for*ld the living God.
Even*ln the sparrow has found a home, and*ld the swallow a nest for herself, where*ld she may have her youngâ€” a*ln place near your altar, Lord*sld Almighty, my King and my God.
Blessed*ln are those who dwell in your house; they*ld are ever praising you.
Blessed*pn are those whose strength is in you, whose*ld hearts are set on pilgrimage.
As*ln they pass through the Valley of Baka, they*ld make it a place of springs; the*ld autumn rains also cover it with pools.
They*ln go from strength to strength, till*ld each appears before God in Zion.
Hear*pn my prayer, Lord*s God Almighty; listen*ld to me, God of Jacob.
Look*ln on our shield, O God; look*ld with favor on your anointed one.
Better*pn is one day in your courts than*ld a thousand elsewhere; I*ln would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God than*ld dwell in the tents of the wicked.
For*ln the Lord*s God is a sun and shield; the*ld Lord*s bestows favor and honor; no*ln good thing does he withhold from*ld those whose walk is blameless.
Lord*spn Almighty, blessed*ld is the one who trusts in you.
